abstract: JPMorgan Chase is lifting a salary freeze on employees earning more than $60,000 a year, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase is lifting a salary freeze on employees earning more than $60,000 a year, according to an internal memorandum obtained by DealBook.
lead_paragraph: The people at JPMorgan Chase have received some good news about their paychecks: The bank is removing a salary freeze for employees earning more than $60,000 a year, with raises taking effect early next year. The freeze was put in place at the height of the financial crisis last year.
